newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso mixed, hit by U.S. long bond.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso mixed, hit by U.S. long bond.

text.p: The Mexican was mixed in early trade on Friday, with longer contracts weakened by a surge in U.S. long bond yields, dealers said.
"The peso has softened on the U.S. long bond, which was hit by strong manufacturing data," a dealer said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour counterpart were 0.95 and 1.5 centavos firmer in early trade, respectively, at 7.8230/7.8270 and 7.8200/7.8240 per dollar.
Same-day peso contracts were meanwhile 0.1 of a centavo firmer at 7.8075/7.8120 per dollar.
U.S. 30-year Treasury bonds sagged 44/32 to yield 6.40 percent in early dealing.
Dealers forecast a trading range of 7.8000/7.8300 per dollar for the session.
